poem:
"Jewels Adorning Men"

Pearls draped on young Lotharios,
Cartier candy round the neck of Chalamet.
An eyebrow piercing mock-thermometer,
Db lustrous glitter on a mundane day.
Circuits of style all lead to Harry,
Grandmother's rings spun into starlight.
Men bedecked not in armor,
But in symbols of delicate defiance.
Bespeaking a soft masculinity,
In the mirror of a silver spoon.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I suspect I’d look like a five-year-old cosplaying as Mr T’: can I pull off the new men’s jewellery? Something’s caught my eye recently – men around town are wearing lots of jewellery. TikTok and Instagram are full of it. Love Island Lotharios in pearls! Timothée Chalamet in a Cartier candy-inspired necklace! Good lord, Jacob Elordi’s thermometer-busting eyebrow piercing in Saltburn. All roads lead back to Harry Styles, with his rock star rings and grandmother". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
